column1: Master of Science (MS) in Critical Infrastructure
column5: Earn a master's of science in critical infrastructure, meet the industry demand for expertiseFrom hospitals to nuclear plants, critical infrastructure is built to be strong and secure. In today’s internet-connected world, however, threats can be digital as well as physical. Organizations need to know how to protect their facilities against a host of potentially crippling cybersecurity threats – from denial of service attacks to worms that can shut down generators or cause equipment to malfunction.
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
